750689482668670976.text: Read the PM's full statement in the @HouseofCommons  following the publication of the report of the Iraq Inquiry https://t.co/NQr8OwG6Va

750658314627911680.text: PM: Britain must not and will not shrink from its role on the world stage, or fail to act to protect its people.

750657589449527296.text: PM: We have enshrined #ArmedForcesCovenant in law to ensure our armed forces & their families receive the treatment & respect they deserve.

750656986480599044.text: PM: On my first day in office, I established the National Security Council to ensure proper co-ordinated decision-making across Government.

750656852497760256.text: PM: Taking the country to war should always be a last resort and should only be done if all credible alternatives have been exhausted.

750656659886923776.text: PM: We can't turn back the clock. But we can ensure that lessons from the Chilcot report are learnt and acted on.

750654195754213376.text: PM: This has been a fully independent inquiry. MPs will have 2 days to debate it next week. #Chilcot

750653770808324097.text: PM: It is a difficult day for the families of those who lost loved ones. I hope they can draw, at least, some solace from today's report.

736090409487601664.text: PM: Finally, on global health, we’ve discussed the pressing need to tackle antimicrobial resistance.

736089738113781761.text: PM: The #G7 has endorsed the London Anti-Corruption Summit’s outcomes, and will play a leading role in their implementation.

736089060737835012.text: PM: I’m delighted to announce that the #G7 has agreed to take forward a coordinated, ambitious global effort to defeat corruption.

736088074514366467.text: PM: Together these developments will help stabilise Libya, secure its coast and tackle the migration crisis.

736087913859940357.text: PM: Once all relevant permissions are in place, I will deploy a naval warship to the south central Mediterranean to combat arms trafficking.

736087306013007872.text: PM: Once a detailed plan has been agreed with the Libyan authorities, the UK will send a UK training team to assist in its implementation.

736082651606437889.text: PM: The G7 is clear that existing sanctions must remain in place until the Minsk agreement is fully implemented.

736082558656512001.text: PM: On Russia, the #G7 has agreed on the vital importance of sanctions rollover in June.

736081410646122500.text: PM: Daesh is its current form. We’ve agreed that the international community must keep up the pressure to defeat this terrorist death cult.

736079791309234176.text: PM: On terrorism #G7 leaders are in unanimous agreement that Islamist extremism is the threat of our generation.

736077987494264832.text: PM: Whether we’re talking about terrorism, the migration crisis, trade, anti-corruption or global health - we can get things done

736075086260637697.text: PM: #G7 is a group of nations bound together by common values & principles – freedom, democracy, the rule of law & respect for human rights.

735075852602478592.text: PM: @easyJet team & I agree: leaving the EU would mean a weaker pound & the average family holiday costing £230 more https://t.co/DMvcgF53ff

735041360013742080.text: PM: There are some very strong arguments – about the cost of a holiday, cost of food, cost of using your mobile phone for staying in the EU.

735039868707868672.text: PM: If we were to leave & the pound were to fall, it could put up the cost of a holiday for a family of 4 to a European destination by £230.

735038789660348416.text: PM: I'm quite convinced when it comes to the economic argument we are better off if we stay in the EU & we are worse off if we leave. #EUref

735038276323663872.text: PM: Prices have come down 40% since the aviation single market & since the transformation that companies like @easyJet have brought about.

735037056758517760.text: PM: If we were to leave the EU it would be bad for our economy: less jobs, less growth, higher prices, a recession for our economy. #EUref

735036337846407168.text: PM: It's good for jobs, it's good for investment, good for business - it means businesses like this can expand throughout the single market.

735035478760529920.text: PM: It's not a complicated argument, we are part of a market of 500 million people. The biggest single market anywhere in the world. #EUref

735035165941084160.text: PM is speaking @easyJet this morning - the cost of holidays and travel could rise if the UK left the EU: https://t.co/p76HyZoJqB

734837609420206080.text: PM: The choice is clear. Leave Europe and risk what we’ve achieved; stay in Europe and stay on the right track. https://t.co/Qm6hSF3w7D

734770337351602176.text: PM: My Telegraph article with the Chancellor on why we must avoid a 'DIY recession' and stay stronger in Europe: https://t.co/gacjI0sMnL

734759213445058560.text: PM spoke on impact of the economic shock if the UK were to vote to leave the EU. Full speech https://t.co/Eh3Rg6u6Xi https://t.co/ut9fA6C8Ch

734705684097425408.text: RT @hmtreasury: Real wages will fall by almost 3% in the first two years of leaving the EU #EUref https://t.co/faphRqCaM6 https://t.co/ncJA…

734683753512095746.text: RT @hmtreasury: As many as 820k jobs could be lost if the UK leaves the EU – find out more here https://t.co/7MdtEKWyjd #EUref

734680301444665344.text: RT @hmtreasury: The Chancellor set out the direct consequence leaving the EU would have on UK jobs, 'within 2 years at least 500,000 jobs w…

734679794504339456.text: RT @hmtreasury: Chancellor: The central conclusion of today's Treasury analysis is that a vote to leave the EU will push the UK economy int…

734679334695342080.text: PM: The choice couldn’t be clearer. Leave Europe – and put at risk what we’ve achieved. Stay in Europe – and stay on the right track. #EUref

734679201001902080.text: PM: Govt was elected just over a year ago to build a Greater Britain out of a Great Recession. Why would we want to put it at risk again?

734679027328397312.text: PM: The job you do, the home you live in are at risk. The shock to our economy after leaving Europe would tip the country into recession.

734678925691998208.text: PM: Today we publish analysis of what would happen in the short term after a British exit as an economic shock shakes our nation @hmtreasury

734678733366398977.text: PM: We already heard from @HMTreasury that the long-term impact of leaving would be a cost to every household equivalent to £4,300.

734678585563320321.text: PM: It means an Eastleigh business can get goods to market anywhere in the EU – & better access to all places the EU has trade deals with.

734678354503315456.text: PM: Britain helped to create the Single Market and it is the source of so much of our economic security. #EUref

734677894371377152.text: PM: 1 month from today, we make a decision that’ll determine our future security. Leaving the EU would put our security at huge risk. #EUref

734675476158001152.text: PM and the Chancellor of the Exchequer are in Eastleigh to talk about the economic shock if the UK were to leave the EU. #EUref @hmtreasury

729575195812442112.text: PM: Far from Britain’s influence in the world being undermined by our membership of the EU, it amplifies our power.

729573959197298688.text: PM: The dangerous international situation means that the closest possible cooperation with our European neighbours is essential.

729573789554577409.text: PM: What happens in Europe affects us, so we must be strong in Europe if we want to be strong at home and in the world.

729573592548179969.text: PM: The reason I want Britain to stay in a reformed EU is that it does help make our country better off, safer and stronger. #EUref

729571453889335296.text: PM: If you want to keep this country strong in the world, & keep our people safe, our membership of the EU is 1 of the tools that helps us.

729571358989012992.text: PM: Today I want to set out the big, bold patriotic case for Britain to remain a member of the European Union. #EUreferendum

711980929024192512.text: PM's @HouseofCommons statement about the #EUTurkey agreement on migration crisis in Europe: https://t.co/p4yq0Dso0u https://t.co/wY5AJOFCko

711951682234617856.text: PM: @EUCouncil I brought together EU leaders to ensure that we are all ready to provide as much support as possible to the Libyan government

711951225021931522.text: PM: What is needed is a government in Libya with whom we can work. so we can co-operate with the Libyan coastguard, in Libyan waters.

711951061028872192.text: PM: Britain has given more money to support Syrians fleeing the war, & the countries hosting them, than any other European country.

711950763384291328.text: PM: Visa free access to Schengen countries only means the right to visit.  It does not mean a right to work. Does not mean a right to settle

711950675182297088.text: PM: We are not giving visa-free access for Turks coming to the UK. We have made our own decision which is to maintain our own borders.

711950562959495168.text: PM: RFA Mounts Bay & Border Force vessels are already patrolling the Aegean. Asylum experts and interpreters are already working in Greece.

711950449633574913.text: PM: What we are doing is contributing our expertise and our skilled officials to help with the large-scale operation now under way.

711950178002067456.text: PM: We have argued for a consistent & clear approach. Ending the conflict. Supporting the refugees in the region. Securing European borders.

711950040470843394.text: PM: Because of our special status in the EU, Britain is not part of the Schengen open border arrangements & we’re not going to be joining.

711949783926239233.text: PM: The single biggest cause has of course been the war in Syria. We have also seen rapid growth of criminal networks of people smugglers.

711949568108269573.text: PM: I would like to make a Statement on last week’s @EUCouncil, which focused on the migration crisis affecting continental Europe.

707943728682557440.text: PM: Looking at what experts say, the way evidence points & what makes our people better off, I believe we should remain in a reformed Europe

707943013377560576.text: PM: So that’s what our membership of a reformed Europe offers: certainty.

707941176784121857.text: PM: If we voted to leave many non-tariff barriers would still be in place, returning to the bad old days of endless forms & bureaucracy.

707940688453828608.text: PM: Thirdly, the Single Market enables the EU to strike the most ambitious and comprehensive trade deals with the world.

707939806584705025.text: PM: Secondly the Single Market doesn’t just eliminate tariffs, it eliminates other barriers to trade - what are known as non-tariff barriers

707937597507682304.text: PM The first big advantage of the Single Market is that British businesses can sell to a continent of customers – 500m people – tariff-free.

707937325121212417.text: PM: I know people want to understand more about Europe & the Single Market. Let me take you through 3 big advantages of the Single Market.

707936761742278656.text: PM: There is going to be lots of debate about Europe over the coming months.  But the biggest issue on 23rd June is our economic future.

701840094769106949.text: PM spoke in @HouseofCommons on how Britain will be stronger, safer & better off in a reformed EU. Full speech https://t.co/NwQ5dy7Cns #EUref

701806369456922625.text: Why the UK will have the best of both worlds - stronger, safer & better off in a reformed EU https://t.co/GK6G6MmJoW https://t.co/yh75DAynFx

701796253613563905.text: PM: To me what matters most is the power to get things done for our people, for our country, and for our future. #EUref

701795998591541250.text: PM: I believe Britain will be stronger, safer and better off by remaining in a reformed European Union. #EUref

701795680210329601.text: PM: This is a vital decision for the future of our country. And we should also be clear that it is a final decision. #EUref

701795393231831040.text: PM: I am today commencing process to propose that British people decide our future in Europe through in-out referendum on Thursday 23 June.

701794865106001920.text: PM: Our special status means we can have best of both worlds. We will be in the parts of Europe that work for us & out of parts that do not.

701794355003191296.text: PM: The reforms we have secured will be legally binding in international law &  cannot be unpicked without the agreement of Britain.

701793983886966784.text: PM: We have a new mechanism to finally enforce the principle that – as far as possible – powers should sit in Westminster, not in Brussels.

701793292661481472.text: PM: We also established a new emergency brake so that EU migrants will have to wait four years until they have full access to our benefits.

701793135572217859.text: PM: We have secured new powers against criminals from other countries including powers to stop them coming here in the first place.

701793024687415296.text: Watch live: the Prime Minister's @HouseofCommons statement on the #EUreferendum: https://t.co/Tku4qSCNRb

701792129241190400.text: PM: We wanted commitments to make Europe more competitive, creating jobs & making British families financially secure. Again we got them.

701791616458223616.text: PM: We have not just permanently protected the pound and our right to keep it, but ensured that we can’t be discriminated against.

701023831985672192.text: PM: The Cabinet has agreed to recommend that the UK remains in a reformed European Union. A referendum will be held on Thursday 23 June.

700957483288887296.text: PM: The Cabinet will this morning discuss the UK's new special status in the EU - afterwards I'll announce the planned referendum date.

700800393018798080.text: PM: I have negotiated a deal to give UK special status in the EU. I will be recommending it to Cabinet tomorrow. Press conference shortly.

700720855186350080.text: PM: Negotiations are continuing into this evening. A Cabinet meeting won't be possible tonight. One will be held if and when a deal is done.

694864994253590528.text: PM: This will offer the best future for jobs, security & strength for our country. And security for families at every stage of their lives.

694863692685512704.text: PM: The draft represents the strongest package we have ever had on tackling the abuse of free movement & closing down back-door routes in.

694863358613442560.text: PM: We are absolutely clear that Britain is going to keep the pound. There must be no discrimination against the pound.

694863038843846656.text: PM: We asked for commitments on European competitiveness, trade deals signed, the single market completed. These are in the draft texts.

694862802973003776.text: PM: Europe is about working together to advance our shared prosperity & security, not about joining some kind of European superstate.

672074120251723776.text: Earlier today, the PM set out his case in the Commons debate on military action in Syria. Read his statement: https://t.co/odffdcX78y

672031767176609792.text: PM: We must stand with our Muslim friends around the world as they reclaim their religion from these terrorists.

672024084486688772.text: PM: It is in Syria where many of the plots against our country are formed. So we must act in Syria to deal with these threats ourselves.

672023759931449344.text: PM: British planes would make a real difference in Syria, just as they are already doing in Iraq.

672022005940662272.text: PM: The House should be under no illusion: these terrorists are plotting to kill us, and to radicalise our children, right now.

672021580235546624.text: PM: This evil death cult is neither a true representation of Islam nor a State.

672019461067644929.text: PM: The threat from ISIL is very real. It is a fundamental threat to our security.

672018402542792704.text: PM: I am absolutely clear that we must pursue a comprehensive strategy that also includes political, diplomatic and humanitarian action.

648397816281333760.text: The PM spoke at #UNGA, calling on world leaders to deliver on aid promises #LeaveNoOneBehind http://t.co/rA4aj4IrOO http://t.co/2DQdTyJdb7

648257077572452352.text: RT @DFID_UK: IN PICTURES: shots from today's events in New York and #UNGA #Generation2030 #LeaveNoOneBehind http://t.co/7ekO2KqmKd http://t…

648252613377552384.text:
RT @UKUN_NewYork: For everyone. Everywhere. And the world's youth will help make them a reality.

#GlobalGoals #LeaveNoOneBehind http://t.c…

648247918655369216.text: PM: If you’re committed to making progress towards these goals, the UK is on your side and we will work with you on our shared quest.

648247806617108481.text: PM: We need a new global partnership, to ensure that all our policies really help to deliver progress for the poorest. #UNGA

648247672764297216.text: PM: Achieving these Goals will take action, not words. As well as aid, we need investment, trade, growth and jobs. #GlobalGoals

648247349735763969.text: PM: We need to put the poorest, weakest and most marginalised first – to #LeaveNoOneBehind

648247169477148673.text: PM: This is a clarion call to the whole world. To eliminate, for the first time in human history, the scourge of extreme poverty

648247029622251520.text: PM: Let’s inspire the world with what we want to achieve - reduce preventable deaths to zero and eradicate extreme poverty in a generation.

648246970952347648.text: PM: We’ve been making these aid promises for years. Now, let us all deliver on them. The world is watching.

648246914627043328.text: PM: Aid is not enough on its own. Of course not. But it is essential. And it works. #GlobalGoals

648246843491680256.text: PM: This investment is helping the world’s poorest and most vulnerable people to build a better life. #UNGA

648246771056013312.text: PM: We’ve kept our promises on aid. We haven’t just achieved the UN’s 0.7% target – we’ve enshrined it in law. #UNGA

648246673060274176.text: PM: I’m proud to lead a country that has made a huge contribution towards this extraordinary progress. #GlobalGoals

648246539643711488.text: PM: We celebrate the huge progress the world has made towards the MDGs and commit to go further with the new Sustainable Development Goals.

648233277770350592.text: RT @DFID_UK: PM David Cameron: #GlobalGoals will take action, not words. I’m proud UK has met 0.7% aid target: http://t.co/cjIAtGKyjT #Leav…

641589564398768128.text: PM: The Queen inspires us all with her incredible service, leadership & grace. Read  in full: http://t.co/RS3AT8GiwR http://t.co/ZgUuMndHmm

641562158472536064.text: PM: We could not be more proud of her. She has served this country with unerring grace, dignity & decency. Long may she continue to do so.

641562087265841153.text: PM: I'm sure I speak for my 11 predecessors that meeting the Queen is one of the most enjoyable, inspiring & humbling honours of this office

641561920441589760.text: PM: She has led a gentle evolution of the monarchy, bringing it closer to the people while maintaining its dignity. #LongestReign

641561855555694592.text: PM: I know that Her Majesty would want us to pay a tribute to the service & support of her whole family, not least the Duke of Edinburgh.

641561776304324608.text: PM: Her Majesty’s contribution to shaping the future of the Commonwealth has been particularly extraordinary. http://t.co/lLUBTm9m7z

641561210475945984.text: PM: She has been a rock of stability in an era in which our country has changed so much providing an enduring focal point for all her people

641561105727422464.text: PM: Her leadership exemplifies the unique combination of tradition & progress that has come to define us as a nation. #LongestReign

641561026736058368.text: PM: Her selfless sense of service & duty have earned her unparalleled respect & admiration not only in Britain, but all around the world.

641560945274261504.text: PM: The Queen inspires us with her incredible service, her dignified leadership & extraordinary grace with which she carries out her duties.

641560687169417216.text: PM: And to thank Her Majesty for the extraordinary service she has given to our country over more than 6 decades. #LongestReign

641560517300101120.text: PM: While I rarely advocate disobeying Her Majesty – I do think we should stop & take a moment to mark this historic milestone #LongestReign

641560439613194240.text: PM: It is of course typical of her selfless sense of service that she would have us treat this day just like any other. #LongestReign

641560343433596928.text: PM: Today Her Majesty the Queen becomes our country’s longest reigning Monarch. #LongestReign http://t.co/MSA1mXcC5W

641509297491460096.text: PM: It is only right that we should celebrate her extraordinary record, as well as the grace & dignity with which she serves our country.

641509010668175360.text: PM: Over the last 63 years, Her Majesty has been a rock of stability in a world of constant change. #LongestReign http://t.co/C1eKEsrwBb

641508502125547520.text: PM: Millions of people across Britain will today mark the historic moment when Queen Elizabeth becomes our longest serving monarch.

613034908483584000.text:
PM: The speech I made today was about making sure we boost the drivers of opportunity: family, education & work.
https://t.co/KDxCw44yri

612956433513058304.text: Read PM's speech on plans to help working families and extend opportunities to all in full: http://t.co/JmmW9xnlKr

612954118202753024.text: PM: By taking on govt failure & backing family, education & work we extend opportunity & could change the lives of many disadvantaged people

612954041891586048.text: PM: We will help more people back into work and increase the minimum wage to £6.70 from October 2015.

612953881883095040.text: PM: Next we need to improve ‘coasting schools’. We will turn around 1,000 more failing schools and improve hundreds more coasting schools.

612952541341614081.text: PM: 117,000 families already turned around by the troubled families programme, 400,000 more families over next five years

612952208657784833.text: PM: Families are the best welfare system there is. In the next 5 years we will double free childcare for 3 & 4 yrs olds with working parents

612950883354152960.text: PM: This is the change we need - to move from a low wage, high tax, high welfare society to a higher wage, lower tax, lower welfare society.

612950205818929152.text: PM: The right track to extend opportunity is to recognise the causes of stalled social mobility and a lack of economic opportunity.

612949866357104640.text: PM: Today I want to make a bigger, & deeper, argument about how we realise the One Nation ideal & help everyone achieve their full potential

612949543387295744.text: PM: I want everyone in this country to have the opportunity to get on & make a good life. That is the task for the next 5 years.

612949484167938049.text: PM: Whoever you are, wherever you live, whatever your background or stage of life I believe this govt can help you fulfil your aspirations.

612949318467756032.text: PM speaking live now on the government's One Nation approach.

610499291900198912.text: PM: 800 yrs ago King John put his seal to #MagnaCarta, a document that would change the world. http://t.co/81LR9bqnKb http://t.co/bpPU5Obxqc

610481756010086400.text: RT @cabinetofficeuk: 800 years ago today, #MagnaCarta set down how the king should consult his barons: http://t.co/WcUh4cgGXK #HistoryGov h…

610444016908402688.text: RT @MagnaCarta800th: The @rafredarrows commemorated 800 years of #MagnaCarta with a fly - past above #Runnymede at 12.15 pm today. http://t…

610421003731144705.text:
PM: I'm here in Runnymede on the banks of the Thames. 800 years ago on this spot, King John sealed the #MagnaCarta.
https://t.co/t2NUYt1xA3

610402365603188736.text: Read PM's #MagnaCarta speech in full: http://t.co/7p8g1XSPNB http://t.co/p4VR0JyQTL

610382184101363712.text: PM: So on this historic day, let’s pledge to keep those principles alight. Let’s keep #MagnaCarta alive.

610382117508399104.text: PM: Liberty, justice, democracy, the rule of law – we hold these things dear and  they took shape right here by the Thames. #MagnaCarta

610382016358576128.text: PM: #MagnaCarta is something every person in Britain should be proud of. Its copies may be faded, but its principles shine as brightly.

610381919583387648.text: PM: The seeds sown here have grown throughout the world. In America; in India with Gandhi and South Africa with Nelson Mandela. #MagnaCarta

610381679480438784.text: PM: The clauses inspiring those who fought in the English Civil War, giving fuel to the Chartists, succour to the Suffragettes. #MagnaCarta

610381513486635008.text: PM: This great charter shaped the world for the best part of a millennium helping to promote arguments for justice and freedom. #MagnaCarta

610381425611776000.text: PM: What is taken for granted here in Britain, is what others are crying out for, hoping for, praying for. #MagnaCarta

610381321752440832.text: PM: The countries that have these things tend to be the long term successes. Those who don’t tend to be the long term failures. #MagnaCarta

610380703499460610.text: PM: All over the world, people are still struggling to live by the rule of law and to see their governments subject to that law. #MagnaCarta

610380567360733184.text: PM: What happened here eight centuries ago is as relevant today as it was then. And that relevance extends far beyond Britain. #MagnaCarta

610380468865888256.text: PM: The limits of executive power, guaranteed access to justice, the rule of law, shouldn’t be imprisonment without trial. #MagnaCarta

610379786523922433.text: PM: 800 years ago, on this day, King John put his seal to a document that would change the world. #MagnaCarta
